author: glasser
msg: Replace use of apr_memcache_t in public API with a wrapper
svn_memcache_t.  Restrict direct use of apr_memcache_t to
cache-memcache.c.  Introduce a new error if the API consumer tries to
do something memcachy (create an svn_memcache_t from a config that
actually wants it, or calls svn_cache_create_memcache) and Subversion
Change argument types to svn_memcache_t, and document what happens
if not built with memcache support.
Conditionalize most of the file on SVN_HAVE_MEMCACHE.
(struct svn_memcache_t): New; either a wrapper around an
(svn_cache_create_memcache): Adjust, and make a version for
config file actually wants a memcache, throw an error.

author: markphip

when "SVNAllowBulkUpdates off" is present in httpd.conf, and by

author: julianfoad
msg: Separate the "replace" scenarios from the "delete" scenarios, because the
Adjust and rename the "merge" tests to reflect that what matters is the
current state of the target rather than some change that happened to it.
Improve some names and comments; remove some sample code.

author: glasser
msg: Revert r30594, r30595, and r30596.  There is a better way.

author: pburba
msg: Add a merge test for part of issue #3067.
